intro: Alafia microstylis, commonly known as the dwarf alafia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its compact, grass-like foliage and small, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of less than 30 centimeters, making it a suitable candidate for container gardening. Its flowers, which are usually white or pale pink, bloom in late spring or early summer. Alafia microstylis prefers well-drained soil and partial to full sun, thriving in warm, humid climates.
